    Direct Known Subclasses:

      • test

        public ClusteringTestResults test(ClusterableIterator<T> theTestIterator,
                         com.davidsoergel.stats.DissimilarityMeasure<String> intraLabelDistances)
                           throws com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionException,
                                  ClusterException
        Evaluates the classification accuracy of this clustering using an iterator of test samples. These samples should not have been used in learning the cluster positions. Determines what proportions of the test samples are classified correctly, incorrectly, or not at all.
        Specified by:
        test in interface ClusteringMethod<T extends Clusterable<T>>
        Parameters:
        theTestIterator - an Iterator of test samples. // @param mutuallyExclusiveLabels a Set of labels that we're trying to classify
        intraLabelDistances - a measure of how different the labels are from each other. For simply determining whether the classification is correct or wrong, use a delta function (i.e. equals). Sometimes, however, one label may be more wrong than another; this allows us to track that.
        Returns:
        a TestResults object encapsulating the proportions of test samples classified correctly, incorrectly, or not at all.
        Throws:
        NoGoodClusterException - when a test sample cannot be assigned to any cluster
        com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionException - when something goes wrong in computing the label probabilities
        ClusterException - when something goes wrong in the bowels of the clustering implementation
